personal.name: Sarah Chen
personal.title: Senior Full-Stack Engineer
personal.summary: Full-stack engineer with 8+ years of experience building scalable web applications and leading engineering teams. Passionate about developer experience, performance optimization, and mentoring junior engineers. Track record of delivering high-impact products at both startups and enterprise companies.

experience.title: Senior Software Engineer
experience.description: Core member of the Payments Platform team, building infrastructure that processes billions of dollars in transactions.
highlights: Led migration of legacy payment processing system to event-driven architecture, reducing latency by 40% and improving reliability to 99.99% uptime
Designed and implemented real-time fraud detection pipeline processing 50K+ transactions per second
Mentored 4 junior engineers through structured 1:1s and code review, with 2 promoted to mid-level within 18 months
Collaborated with product and design to ship payment methods expansion to 12 new countries, increasing merchant adoption by 35%

experience.title: Software Engineer II
highlights: Built React component library used by 200+ engineers, reducing UI development time by 30%
Optimized search results page performance, improving Core Web Vitals scores from 45 to 92
Led cross-functional initiative to implement A/B testing framework, enabling 50+ concurrent experiments
On-call rotation lead for guest-facing services with 10M+ daily active users

experience.title: Software Engineer
highlights: Developed bank connection infrastructure supporting 11,000+ financial institutions
Implemented OAuth 2.0 authentication flows for 50+ bank integrations
Reduced API response times by 60% through database query optimization and caching strategies
Created internal dashboard for operations team, reducing manual account review time by 75%

experience.title: Software Development Intern
highlights: Built prototype for Azure DevOps feature that was later shipped to production
Received return offer and "exceeds expectations" rating
Dean's Honor List (6 semesters)
Teaching Assistant for CS 61B: Data Structures
HackBerkeley organizer and mentor

projects.name: OpenMetrics
projects.description: Open-source observability platform for modern applications. Built with Go and React, deployed on Kubernetes.
highlights: 2,400+ GitHub stars
Used in production by 50+ companies
Featured in CNCF landscape

projects.name: DevSync
projects.description: Real-time collaborative code editor with vim keybindings. Side project exploring CRDTs and WebRTC.
highlights: 1,000+ monthly active users
Featured on Hacker News front page

publications.title: Scaling Event-Driven Architectures: Lessons from Stripe

awards.name: Engineering Excellence Award
awards.description: Quarterly award for exceptional technical contribution

volunteer.description: Mentor underrepresented engineers through career development and technical interview prep
